title: Department store Fenwick swings to £44m loss amid high street turmoil
text:
Upmarket department store Fenwick blamed troubles sweeping the high street as it revealed a slump in sales and swung to a loss.

The family-owned firm plunged to a £44.2m loss in the year to Jan 25, compared with a profit of £2m a year earlier, the latest figures showed.

Comparable sales at Fenwick’s nine shops across the UK tumbled 15.8pc, with total revenues down 13.6pc to £355m.

Fenwick said the results reflected “the tough retail trading environment”.

Fenwick was founded in 1882 by John James Fenwick in Newcastle as a single store selling mantles, silk goods, dresses, fabrics and trimmings.

The company expanded into a department store eight years later when John’s eldest son, Fred, joined...
description: Upmarket department store Fenwick blamed troubles sweeping the high street as it revealed a slump in sales and swung to a loss.
